{"step_by_step_thinking": "The lateral pharyngeal space, also known as the parapharyngeal space, is an area in the neck that is involved in the spread of infections from the oral cavity and pharynx. It is directly connected to the buccal space, submandibular space, and retropharyngeal space. However, it is not directly connected to the sublingual space, which is located under the tongue and is separated from the lateral pharyngeal space by several anatomical structures.", "answer_choice": "B. Sublingual space"}
